org.apache.juneau.rest.client

Class RestCall

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Session
      • org.apache.juneau.BeanSession
        • org.apache.juneau.rest.client.RestCall
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public final class RestCall
extends BeanSession
implements Closeable
    Represents a connection to a remote REST resource.

    Instances of this class are created by the various doX() methods on the RestClient class.

    This class uses only Java standard APIs. Requests can be built up using a fluent interface with method chaining, like so...

    RestClient client = new RestClient(); RestCall c = client.doPost(URL).setInput(o).setHeader(x,y); MyBean b = c.getResponse(MyBean.class);

    The actual connection and request/response transaction occurs when calling one of the getResponseXXX() methods.

    See Also:
    • Overview > juneau-rest-client

    • Constructor Detail

      • RestCall

        protected RestCall(RestClient client,
                   org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpRequestBase request,
                   URI uri)
            throws RestCallException
        Constructs a REST call with the specified method name.
        Parameters:
        client - The client that created this request.
        request - The wrapped Apache HTTP client request object.
        uri - The URI for this call.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.

    • Method Detail

      • uri

        public RestCall uri(Object uri)
             throws RestCallException
        Sets the URI for this call.

        Can be any of the following types:

        • URI
        • URL
        • URIBuilder
        • Anything else converted to a string using Object.toString().

        Relative URL strings will be interpreted as relative to the root URL defined on the client.

        Parameters:
        uri - The URI to use for this call. This overrides the URI passed in from the client.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException

      • scheme

        public RestCall scheme(String scheme)
        Sets the URI scheme.
        Parameters:
        scheme - The new URI host.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

        Sets the URI port.
        Parameters:
        port - The new URI port.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • query

        public RestCall query(String name,
                      Object value,
                      boolean skipIfEmpty,
                      HttpPartSerializer serializer,
                      HttpPartSchema schema)
               throws RestCallException
        Adds a query parameter to the URI query.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name. Can be null/blank/* if the value is a Map, String, NameValuePairs, or bean.
        value - The parameter value converted to a string using UON notation. Can also be Map, String, NameValuePairs, or bean if the name is null/blank/*. If a String and the name is null/blank/*, then calls URIBuilder.setCustomQuery(String).
        skipIfEmpty - Don't add the pair if the value is empty.
        serializer - The serializer to use for serializing the value to a string value. If null, then the URL-encoding serializer defined on the client is used.
        schema - The schema object that defines the format of the output.
        If null, defaults to the schema defined on the serializer.
        If that's also null, defaults to HttpPartSchema.DEFAULT.
        Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. OpenApiSerializer).
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException

      • query

        public RestCall query(String name,
                      Object value)
               throws RestCallException
        Adds a query parameter to the URI query.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        value - The parameter value converted to a string using UON notation.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException

      • query

        public RestCall query(Map<String,Object> params)

        Adds query parameters to the URI query.
        Parameters:
        params - The parameters. Values are converted to a string using UON notation.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • formData

        public RestCall formData(String name,
                         Object value,
                         boolean skipIfEmpty,
                         HttpPartSerializer serializer,
                         HttpPartSchema schema)
                  throws RestCallException
        Adds a form data pair to this request to perform a URL-encoded form post.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name. Can be null/blank/* if the value is a Map, NameValuePairs, or bean.
        value - The parameter value converted to a string using UON notation. Can also be Map, NameValuePairs, or bean if the name is null/blank/*.
        skipIfEmpty - Don't add the pair if the value is empty.
        serializer - The serializer to use for serializing the value to a string value. If null, then the URL-encoding serializer defined on the client is used.
        schema - The schema object that defines the format of the output.
        If null, defaults to the schema defined on the serializer.
        If that's also null, defaults to HttpPartSchema.DEFAULT.
        Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. OpenApiSerializer).
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException

      • formData

        public RestCall formData(String name,
                         Object value)
                  throws RestCallException
        Adds a form data pair to this request to perform a URL-encoded form post.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name. Can be null/blank if the value is a Map or NameValuePairs.
        value - The parameter value converted to a string using UON notation. Can also be a Map or NameValuePairs.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If name was null/blank and value wasn't a Map or NameValuePairs.

      • path

        public RestCall path(String name,
                     Object value,
                     HttpPartSerializer serializer,
                     HttpPartSchema schema)
              throws RestCallException
        Replaces a variable of the form "{name}" in the URL path with the specified value.
        Parameters:
        name - The path variable name.
        value - The replacement value.
        serializer - The serializer to use for serializing the value to a string value. If null, then the URL-encoding serializer defined on the client is used.
        schema - The schema object that defines the format of the output.
        If null, defaults to the schema defined on the serializer.
        If that's also null, defaults to HttpPartSchema.DEFAULT.
        Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. OpenApiSerializer).
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If variable could not be found in path.

      • requestBodySchema

        public RestCall requestBodySchema(HttpPartSchema value)
        Specifies the part schema for the request body.

        This is only useful for schema-aware serializers such as OpenApiSerializer.

        Parameters:
        value - The new part schema for the request body.
        Can be null.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • responseBodySchema

        public RestCall responseBodySchema(HttpPartSchema value)
        Specifies the part schema for the response body.

        This is only useful for schema-aware parsers such as OpenApiParser.

        Parameters:
        value - The new part schema for the response body.
        Can be null.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • body

        public RestCall body(Object input)
              throws RestCallException
        Sets the input for this REST call.
        Parameters:
        input - The input to be sent to the REST resource (only valid for PUT and POST) requests.
        Can be of the following types:
        • Reader - Raw contents of Reader will be serialized to remote resource.
        • InputStream - Raw contents of InputStream will be serialized to remote resource.
        • Object - POJO to be converted to text using the Serializer registered with the RestClient.
        • HttpEntity - Bypass Juneau serialization and pass HttpEntity directly to HttpClient.
        • NameValuePairs - Converted to a URL-encoded FORM post.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If a retry was attempted, but the entity was not repeatable.

      • serializer

        public RestCall serializer(Serializer serializer)
        Specifies the serializer to use on this call.

        Overrides the serializer specified on the RestClient.

        Parameters:
        serializer - The serializer used to serialize POJOs to the body of the HTTP request.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • parser

        public RestCall parser(Parser parser)
        Specifies the parser to use on this call.

        Overrides the parser specified on the RestClient.

        Parameters:
        parser - The parser used to parse POJOs from the body of the HTTP response.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • header

        public RestCall header(String name,
                       Object value,
                       boolean skipIfEmpty,
                       HttpPartSerializer serializer,
                       HttpPartSchema schema)
                throws RestCallException
        Sets a header on the request.
        Parameters:
        name - The header name. The name can be null/empty if the value is a Map.
        value - The header value.
        skipIfEmpty - Don't add the header if the name is null/empty.
        serializer - The serializer to use for serializing the value to a string value. If null, then the URL-encoding serializer defined on the client is used.
        schema - The schema object that defines the format of the output.
        If null, defaults to the schema defined on the serializer.
        If that's also null, defaults to HttpPartSchema.DEFAULT.
        Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. OpenApiSerializer).
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException

      • header

        public RestCall header(String name,
                       Object value)
                throws RestCallException
        Sets a header on the request.
        Parameters:
        name - The header name. The name can be null/empty if the value is a Map.
        value - The header value.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException

        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException

                           Object value)

      • retryable

        public RestCall retryable(int retries,
                          long interval,
                          RetryOn retryOn)
                   throws RestCallException
        Make this call retryable if an error response (>=400) is received.
        Parameters:
        retries - The number of retries to attempt.
        interval - The time in milliseconds between attempts.
        retryOn - Optional object used for determining whether a retry should be attempted. If null, uses RetryOn.DEFAULT.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If current entity is not repeatable.

      • allowRedirectsOnPosts

        public RestCall allowRedirectsOnPosts(boolean b)
        For this call, allow automatic redirects when a 302 or 307 occurs when performing a POST.

        Note that this can be inefficient since the POST body needs to be serialized twice. The preferred approach if possible is to use the LaxRedirectStrategy strategy on the underlying HTTP client. However, this method is provided if you don't have access to the underlying client.

        Parameters:
        b - Redirect flag.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • pipeTo

        public RestCall pipeTo(Writer w)
        Pipes the request output to the specified writer when run() is called.

        The writer is not closed.

        This method can be called multiple times to pipe to multiple writers.

        Parameters:
        w - The writer to pipe the output to.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

                       boolean close)

        Parameters:
        w - The writer to write the output to.
        close - Close the writer when close() is called.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • pipeTo

        public RestCall pipeTo(String id,
                       Writer w,
                       boolean close)

        This method can be called multiple times to pipe to multiple writers.

        Parameters:
        id - A string identifier that can be used to retrieve the writer using getWriter(String)

        close - Close the writer when close() is called.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • ignoreErrors

        public RestCall ignoreErrors()
        Prevent RestCallExceptions from being thrown when HTTP status 400+ is encountered.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • captureResponse

        public RestCall captureResponse()
        Stores the response text so that it can later be captured using getCapturedResponse().

        This method should only be called once. Multiple calls to this method are ignored.

        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • failurePattern

        public RestCall failurePattern(String errorPattern)
        Look for the specified regular expression pattern in the response output.

        Causes a RestCallException to be thrown if the specified pattern is found in the output.

        This method uses getCapturedResponse() to read the response text and so does not affect the other output methods such as getResponseAsString().

        Example:

        // Throw a RestCallException if FAILURE or ERROR is found in the output. restClient.doGet(URL) .failurePattern("FAILURE|ERROR") .run();

        Parameters:
        errorPattern - A regular expression to look for in the response output.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • successPattern

        public RestCall successPattern(String successPattern)
        Look for the specified regular expression pattern in the response output.

        Causes a RestCallException to be thrown if the specified pattern is not found in the output.

        This method uses getCapturedResponse() to read the response text and so does not affect the other output methods such as getResponseAsString().

        Example:

        // Throw a RestCallException if SUCCESS is not found in the output. restClient.doGet(URL) .successPattern("SUCCESS") .run();

        Parameters:
        successPattern - A regular expression to look for in the response output.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • responsePattern

        public RestCall responsePattern(ResponsePattern responsePattern)
        Adds a response pattern finder to look for regular expression matches in the response output.

        This method can be called multiple times to add multiple response pattern finders.

        ResponsePatterns use the getCapturedResponse() to read the response text and so does not affect the other output methods such as getResponseAsString().

        Parameters:
        responsePattern - The response pattern finder.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • setConfig

        public RestCall setConfig(org.apache.http.client.config.RequestConfig config)
        Set configuration settings on this request.

        Use RequestConfig.custom() to create configuration parameters for the request.

        Parameters:
        config - The new configuration settings for this request.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • run

        public int run()
        throws RestCallException
        Method used to execute an HTTP response where you're only interested in the HTTP response code.

        The response entity is discarded unless one of the pipe methods have been specified to pipe the output to an output stream or writer.

        Example:

        try { RestClient client = new RestClient(); int rc = client.doGet(url).execute(); // Succeeded! } catch (RestCallException e) { // Failed! }

        Returns:
        The HTTP status code.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.

      • runFuture

        public Future<Integer> runFuture()
                          throws RestCallException
        Same as run() but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
        Returns:
        The HTTP status code.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If the executor service was not defined.
        See Also:
        for defining the executor service for creating {@link Future Futures}.

      • connect

        public RestCall connect()
                 throws RestCallException
        Connects to the REST resource.

        If this is a PUT or POST, also sends the input to the remote resource.

        Typically, you would only call this method if you're not interested in retrieving the body of the HTTP response. Otherwise, you're better off just calling one of the getReader()/getResponse(Class)/pipeTo(Writer) methods directly which automatically call this method already.

        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If an exception or 400+ HTTP status code occurred during the connection attempt.

      • getReader

        public Reader getReader()
                 throws IOException
        Connects to the remote resource (if connect() hasn't already been called) and returns the HTTP response message body as a reader.

        If an Encoder has been registered with the RestClient, then the underlying input stream will be wrapped in the encoded stream (e.g. a GZIPInputStream).

        If present, automatically handles the charset value in the Content-Type response header.

        IMPORTANT: It is your responsibility to close this reader once you have finished with it.

        Returns:
        The HTTP response message body reader. null if response was successful but didn't contain a body (e.g. HTTP 204).
        Throws:
        IOException - If an exception occurred while streaming was already occurring.

      • getCapturedResponse

        public String getCapturedResponse()
        Returns the response text as a string if captureResponse() was called on this object.

        Note that while similar to getResponseAsString(), this method can be called multiple times to retrieve the response text multiple times.

        Note that this method returns null if you have not called one of the methods that cause the response to be processed. (e.g. run(), getResponse(), getResponseAsString().

        Returns:
        The captured response, or null if captureResponse() has not been called.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If trying to call this method before the response is consumed.

      • getContentLength

        public int getContentLength()
                     throws IOException
        Returns the value of the Content-Length header.
        Returns:
        The value of the Content-Length header, or -1 if header is not present.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getInputStream

        public InputStream getInputStream()
                           throws IOException
        Connects to the remote resource (if connect() hasn't already been called) and returns the HTTP response message body as an input stream.

        If an Encoder has been registered with the RestClient, then the underlying input stream will be wrapped in the encoded stream (e.g. a GZIPInputStream).

        IMPORTANT: It is your responsibility to close this reader once you have finished with it.

        Returns:
        The HTTP response message body input stream. null if response was successful but didn't contain a body (e.g. HTTP 204).
        Throws:
        IOException - If an exception occurred while streaming was already occurring.
        IllegalStateException - If an attempt is made to read the response more than once.

      • getResponseAsString

        public String getResponseAsString()
                           throws IOException
        Connects to the remote resource (if connect() hasn't already been called) and returns the HTTP response message body as plain text.

        The response entity is discarded unless one of the pipe methods have been specified to pipe the output to an output stream or writer.

        Returns:
        The response as a string.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.
        IOException - If an exception occurred while streaming was already occurring.

      • getResponseHeader

        public String getResponseHeader(String name)
                         throws IOException
        Connects to the remote resource (if connect() hasn't already been called) and returns the value of an HTTP header on the response.

        Useful if you're only interested in a particular header value from the response and not the body of the response.

        The response entity is discarded unless one of the pipe methods have been specified to pipe the output to an output stream or writer.

        Parameters:
        name - The header name.
        Returns:
        The response header as a string, or null if the header was not found.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.
        IOException - If an exception occurred while streaming was already occurring.

      • getResponseHeader

        public <T> T getResponseHeader(HttpPartParser partParser,
                               HttpPartSchema schema,
                               String name,
                               Class<T> c)
                        throws IOException,
                               ParseException
        Same as getResponseHeader(String) except parses the header value using the specified part parser and schema.
        Parameters:
        name - The header name.
        partParser - The part parser to use for parsing the header.
        schema - The part schema. Can be null.
        c - The type to convert the part into.
        Returns:
        The parsed part.
        Throws:
        IOException
        ParseException

      • getResponseHeader

        public <T> T getResponseHeader(HttpPartParser partParser,
                               HttpPartSchema schema,
                               String name,
                               Type type,
                               Type... args)
                        throws IOException,
                               ParseException
        Same as getResponseHeader(String) except parses the header value using the specified part parser and schema.
        Parameters:
        name - The header name.
        partParser - The part parser to use for parsing the header.
        schema - The part schema. Can be null.
        type - The type to convert the part into.
        args - The type arguments to convert the part into.
        Returns:
        The parsed part.
        Throws:
        IOException
        ParseException

      • getResponseCode

        public int getResponseCode()
                    throws IOException
        Connects to the remote resource (if connect() hasn't already been called) and returns the HTTP response code.

        Useful if you're only interested in the status code and not the body of the response.

        The response entity is discarded unless one of the pipe methods have been specified to pipe the output to an output stream or writer.

        Returns:
        The response code.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.
        IOException - If an exception occurred while streaming was already occurring.

      • getResponseAsStringFuture

        public Future<String> getResponseAsStringFuture()
                                         throws RestCallException
        Same as getResponse(Class) but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
        Returns:
        The response as a string.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If the executor service was not defined.
        See Also:
        for defining the executor service for creating {@link Future Futures}.

      • getResponse

        public <T> T getResponse(Class<T> type)
                  throws IOException,
                         ParseException
        Same as getResponse(Type, Type...) except optimized for a non-parameterized class.

        This is the preferred parse method for simple types since you don't need to cast the results.

        Examples:

        // Parse into a string. String s = restClient.doGet(url).getResponse(String.class); // Parse into a bean. MyBean b = restClient.doGet(url).getResponse(MyBean.class); // Parse into a bean array. MyBean[] ba = restClient.doGet(url).getResponse(MyBean[].class); // Parse into a linked-list of objects. List l = restClient.doGet(url).getResponse(LinkedList.class); // Parse into a map of object keys/values. Map m = restClient.doGet(url).getResponse(TreeMap.class);

        Notes:
        • You can also specify any of the following types:
          • HttpResponse - Returns the raw HttpResponse returned by the inner HttpClient.
          • Reader - Returns access to the raw reader of the response.
          • InputStream - Returns access to the raw input stream of the response.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type of the object being created. See getResponse(Type, Type...) for details.
        Parameters:
        type - The object type to create.
        Returns:
        The parsed object.
        Throws:
        ParseException - If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
        IOException - If a connection error occurred.

      • getResponseFuture

        public <T> Future<T> getResponseFuture(Class<T> type)
                                throws RestCallException
        Same as getResponse(Class) but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type of the object being created. See getResponse(Type, Type...) for details.
        Parameters:
        type - The object type to create.
        Returns:
        The parsed object.
        Throws:
        RestCallException - If the executor service was not defined.
        See Also:
        for defining the executor service for creating {@link Future Futures}.

      • getResponse

        public <T> T getResponse(Type type,
                         Type... args)
                  throws IOException,
                         ParseException
        Parses HTTP body into the specified object type.

        The type can be a simple type (e.g. beans, strings, numbers) or parameterized type (collections/maps).

        Examples:

        // Parse into a linked-list of strings. List l = restClient.doGet(url).getResponse(LinkedList.class, String.class); // Parse into a linked-list of beans. List l = restClient.doGet(url).getResponse(LinkedList.class, MyBean.class); // Parse into a linked-list of linked-lists of strings. List l = restClient.doGet(url).getResponse(LinkedList.class, LinkedList.class, String.class); // Parse into a map of string keys/values. Map m = restClient.doGet(url).getResponse(TreeMap.class, String.class, String.class); // Parse into a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans. Map m = restClient.doGet(url).getResponse(TreeMap.class, String.class, List.class, MyBean.class);

        Collection classes are assumed to be followed by zero or one objects indicating the element type.

        Map classes are assumed to be followed by zero or two meta objects indicating the key and value types.

        The array can be arbitrarily long to indicate arbitrarily complex data structures.

        Notes:
        • Use the getResponse(Class) method instead if you don't need a parameterized map/collection.
        • You can also specify any of the following types:
          • HttpResponse - Returns the raw HttpResponse returned by the inner HttpClient.
          • Reader - Returns access to the raw reader of the response.
          • InputStream - Returns access to the raw input stream of the response.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type of the object to create.
        Parameters:
        type - The object type to create.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        args - The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
        Returns:
        The parsed object.
        Throws:
        ParseException - If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
        IOException - If a connection error occurred.
        See Also:
        for argument syntax for maps and collections.

      • getResponseBody

        public <T> T getResponseBody(Type type,
                             Type... args)
                      throws IOException,
                             ParseException
        Same as getResponse(Type, Type...) but allows you to specify a part parser to use for parsing the response.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type of the object to create.
        Parameters:
        type - The object type to create.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        args - The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
        Returns:
        The parsed object.
        Throws:
        ParseException - If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed, or is not valid for the specified type.
        IOException - If a connection error occurred.
        See Also:
        for argument syntax for maps and collections.

      • getResponseFuture

        public <T> Future<T> getResponseFuture(Type type,
                                       Type... args)

        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type of the object being created. See getResponse(Type, Type...) for details.
        Parameters:
        type - The object type to create.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        args - The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.

        The parsed object.

        RestCallException - If the executor service was not defined.
        See Also:

      • getResponsePojoRest

        public PojoRest getResponsePojoRest(Class<?> innerType)
                             throws IOException,
                                    ParseException
        Parses the output from the connection into the specified type and then wraps that in a PojoRest.

        Useful if you want to quickly retrieve a single value from inside of a larger JSON document.

        Parameters:
        innerType - The class type of the POJO being wrapped.
        Returns:
        The parsed output wrapped in a PojoRest.
        Throws:
        IOException - If a connection error occurred.
        ParseException - If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed for the Content-Type header.

      • getResponsePojoRest

        public PojoRest getResponsePojoRest()
                             throws IOException,
                                    ParseException
        Converts the output from the connection into an ObjectMap and then wraps that in a PojoRest.

        Useful if you want to quickly retrieve a single value from inside of a larger JSON document.

        Returns:
        The parsed output wrapped in a PojoRest.
        Throws:
        IOException - If a connection error occurred.
        ParseException - If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed for the Content-Type header.

                                         throws IOException

        Returns null if connect() has not yet been called.

        Returns:
        The HTTP response object.
        Throws:
        IOException

        Throws:
        RestCallException

      • softClose

        public RestCall softClose()
        If called, the underlying response stream will not be closed when you call close().

        This is useful in cases where you want access to that stream after you've already cleaned up this object. However, it is your responsibility to close that stream yourself.

        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
